Pre-Game Insights: Craig Goodwin is looking to continue his strong club form for the Socceroos as he prepares to don the Green and Gold in his beloved Adelaide under new boss Tony Popovic.

The match against China PR at Adelaide Oval will bring to an end a seven-year wait for South Australia and Goodwin, as the winger gets set to play in his hometown for the first time in his national team career.
Goodwin has become a leading light for South Australian football with his heroic performances in Green and Gold and former club Adelaide United.
Goodwin expressed his delight at playing in Adelaide, stating he has been vocal about getting a game there and expects a packed-out stadium.
Goodwin highlighted the good marketing efforts in Adelaide, including posters at the airport, creating a different vibe.
The match at Adelaide Oval will mark a new era for the Green and Gold, with Tony Popovic joining as the new head coach of the Subway Socceroos.
Goodwin praised new coach Tony Popovic for his success and winning mentality, which he hopes will be instilled in the team.
Goodwin is keen to impress Popovic in front of his friends, family, and fans at Adelaide Oval after a strong start to his Saudi Pro League season for Al-Wehda.

Goodwin emphasized the importance of reflecting on performances and feeling the weight of wearing the Australia badge after a disappointing start to Round Three of the FIFA World Cup 2026 qualifying campaign.
Goodwin stressed the need for Australia to focus on their own game and be aggressive in their play against China PR.
Goodwin expressed confidence in the squad and coaches to achieve something special in the match against China PR.
